title: Rodger Federer rows with umpire during Alexander Zverev defeat at Shanghai Masters
text:
Roger Federer was beaten in three sets by Alexander Zverev at the Shanghai Masters (Picture: Getty)

Roger Federer was involved in an angry altercation with umpire Nacho Forcadell during his surprise Shanghai Masters defeat against Alexander Zverev.

The Swiss ace cut an uncharacteristically flustered figure throughout a tetchy encounter and, after squaring the match having saved five match points in the second set, lost his composure in the decider.

An angry Federer twice hit the ball out of the court and was handed a rare point penalty when he was 3-0 behind and staring defeat in the face midway through the final set.

Not very often that being Roger Federer works against Roger Federer, but you have to wonder if Nacho Forcadell was overcorrecting here so as not to be accused of going soft on him?? Maybe? pic.twitter.com/bd5l9vl25h — Blair Henley (@BlairHenley) October 11, 2019

Zverev, meanwhile, will now face either Dominic Thiem or Matteo Berrettini in the semi finals.

With Rafael Nadal injured and Novak Djokovic having slipped to a surprise defeat against Stefanos Tsitsipas earlier on Friday, the tournament is beginning to open up for the 22-year-old German.

‘I played great tennis and didn’t do unforced errors or anything like that,’ said Zverev after registering his first win of the year against a top 10 ranked opponent.

‘I knew if I keep playing the way I was playing in the first two sets I was going to have a chance in the third as well.

‘I am finally starting to play the way I should play. I was playing really defensive earlier in the year and not with a lot of confidence.

‘Everybody knows I had a lot of things going on in my life and that can affect your on-court performance.

‘I am starting to play some better tennis and i hope I can continue this way.’
